intro.value: You know Karen. You’ve seen her at Red Lobster, the ballpark, and stuck in traffic.

But how did Karen become Karen — an entitled middle-aged white woman who needs to speak to the manager? According to baby name data from the Social Security Administration (SSA), Karen first appeared in the female Top 20 in 1941 and spent 30 years there until it dropped out in 1971. By the 1990s, Karen had fallen out of the Top 100.

Chances are you don’t know too many Karens today, but when Karen hit it’s peak at #3 in 1965 Karens were everywhere. It’s this swift decay in popularity that’s made Karen so era defining (like Patricia before her, and Shirley before her) and that’s why the name has found new notoriety as a pejorative meme. Karen has become the perfect caricature of women of a certain age and a certain privilege.

Charting Karen’s trajectory got us thinking: are there other names that are equally as Karen as Karen? First we gathered baby names from 1918–2018. Then we dropped any name that never made it to the Top 20 (to account for popularity) and didn’t appear in the top list at least half of the years, or 50 out of 100 (to account for longevity). That left us with 129 female names and 76 male names (yes, we’re going there too!) to test correlation. Here’s what we found...

otherKarens.value: Recently there’s been debate about if Karen is a racist or sexist slur akin to using the n-word. We’re here to tell you it’s not. Don’t believe us? Take it from a Karen herself. But, if you’re seriously tired of seeing the name Karen everywhere, we’ve got you covered. Here are the names that most closely follow Karen’s trajectory to use instead.

futureKarens.value: We know that Karen is most likely middle aged (Ok, Boomer) and past her prime, but what about future Karens? What names should we look out for? Here are the names that most closely follow Karen’s trajectory shifted out 10, 20, and 30 years.

maleKarens.value: Karen is largely reserved for women (white women), but is there a male equivalent? Maybe it’s Ian, like Urban Dictionary suggests. Or maybe it’s Rand of Middle Class Fancy fame. Here are the male names that most closely follow Karen’s trajectory.

futureMales.value: We’re all about future proofing at The Pudding, so we’ve projected out male future Karens too. Here are the male names that most closely follow Karen’s trajectory shifted out 10, 20, and 30 years.
